poem:
**God's Campaign Manager**

James Dobson, now a headline,  
once turned the airwaves  
into corridors of moral marching,  
mobilizing souls with a microphone.  
Forty years of Sundays,  
he cued the faithful vote,  
while in pews, hearts whispered  
their questions to saints  
too busy politicking Heaven  
on gospel truths and ballots.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "James Dobson obituary James Dobson, who has died aged 89, was for many years one of the leading members of the religious right in the US, mobilising the millions of followers of his daily television and radio broadcasts over more than 40 years, invariably to vote on supposedly moral grounds for Republican candidates, even Donald Trump. In the early 2000s Dobson was described by the New York Times as the most influential evangelical leader in". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
